text:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes each of the following sentences

Even after his explanations, I was none the ___________
explanation:
The phrase "none the wiser" is an idiom that means not having gained any additional knowledge or understanding despite an explanation or situation. In this context, the person is stating that even after receiving explanations, they did not become more knowledgeable or wiser.
Option A, "wiser," is the correct choice to complete the sentence and maintain the idiomatic expression. The other options ("wise," "wisest," and "worse") do not fit the intended meaning of the phrase "none the wiser."

text:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word or group of words as it is used in the sentence

The coach, as well as the players....given fantastic gifts last month.
explanation:
The subject of the sentence is"The coach", and the phrase"as well as the players"is an additional, non-essential phrase that does not change the singular nature of the subject. Since "The coach" is singular, the correct verb should also be singular:"was".
Thus, the correct sentence is:"The coach, as well as the players, was given fantastic gifts last month."

text:
From the words lettered A to D below each of the following sentences, choose the word or group of words as it is used in the sentence

Every one of the boys.....excited about the picnic.
explanation: The sentence "Every one of the boys seems excited about the picnic" deals with the subject-verb agreement. "Every one of the boys" is a singular subject because "every one" refers to each individual boy in the group, and it's treated as a singular unit. The verb that agrees with a singular subject is "seems". This is the correct form for the third-person singular present tense.
